revision:
Conversion of solid from one shape to another

  1. The volume of the new shape will be the same as the volume of the earlier shape if the object undergoes processes like recasting, melting, reshaping etc.
  2. volume of a hollow cylinder\(=\pi \times h \times [R^2-r^2]\), where h is the height of the cylinder and r, R are the inner and outer radius respectively.
